newsitem.title: INDIA: India Infosys rises 10 pct on bonus news.
newsitem.headline: India Infosys rises 10 pct on bonus news.

text.p: Shares of India's leading software firm, Infosys Technologies jumped 112 rupees, or 10 percent, to 1,242 at the Bombay exchange on Friday after the company said it would meet on April 8 for a bonus equity issue, brokers said.
The company said its board of directors would also meet on April 8 to finalise results for 1996/97 (April-March).
Infosys which is a favourite stock of foreign funds is expected to announce better results on Friday, analysts said.
"We are expecting a 49 percent jump in its net profit to 313.7 million rupees in 1997 against the year-ago period," Niraj Somaiya, analyst at brokerage H.G. Asia told Reuters on Friday.
"The stock is number one on the list of foreign institutional investors (FII's) ," Somaiya said. "This is a very good growth story of a company which has maintained its business focus."
Infosys now ranks among India's top software firms and boasts a client base of over 60 Fortune 500 companies.
FII limit in the stock has already reached the 24 percent limit, India's central bank said last month.
